Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices

summary:
Key Points:
- The project involves digitizing the current manual loan application process at XYZ Bank through a Digital Loan Application and Approval System.
- The business objective is to build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility assessments, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval digitally.
- The platforms will have features such as an online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based pre-fill, integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit scores, an AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module, real-time KYC document verification, and loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication.
- Home loan, car loan, business loan modules, and assistance for Tier 3 regions are out of scope.
- The key stakeholders are Product Manager Rahul Sharma, Business Head - Retail Lending Priya Iyer, IT Manager Rakesh Sinha, and Compliance Lead Anjali Mehta.
- The project timeline proposes requirements finalization by 15 March 2025, development kickoff by 1 April 2025, UAT by 1 June 2025, and go-live by 1 July 2025.
- Success metrics include reducing TAT from 5 days to 2 hours, achieving an 80% reduction in manual data entry, and 90% accuracy in eligibility checks.
- Risks highlighted include delays in API access to the credit bureau, resistance from customers uncomfortable with digital onboarding, and changes in compliance due to upcoming RBI guidelines.

Actions:
- Begin the development phase in April 2025 and ensure all necessary stakeholders and teams are aware.

Blockers:
- Delay in API access to credit bureau.
- Customer resistance to digital onboarding.
- Potential compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines.
requirements:
Business Requirement 1:
As a banking customer, I want to apply for a loan online, so that I can avoid physical visits to the bank and speed up my loan application process.
Acceptance Criteria: The system accepts online loan application forms with all necessary information and attachments.
Roles: Banking Customer, IT Manager, Compliance Lead
Expected Behavior: The system validates the information entered by the customer and prompts them for any missing or incorrect information.

Business Requirement 2:
As a banking customer, I want my loan eligibility to be assessed instantly, so that I can understand if I can progress with the loan application.
Acceptance Criteria: The system retrieves the credit score of the customer from the credit bureau and uses AI module to assess eligibility.
Roles: Banking Customer, IT Manager, Product Manager
Expected Behavior: The system accesses the credit score of the customer, performs risk assessment and gives a real-time decision on the loan eligibility of the customer.

Business Requirement 3:
As a banking customer, I want to upload my KYC documents digitally, so that I do not have to visit the bank for document verification.
Acceptance Criteria: The system accepts digital uploads of necessary KYC documents and verifies them in real-time.
Roles: Banking Customer, IT Manager, Compliance Lead
Expected Behavior: The system prompts the customer for necessary KYC documents, accepts their digital versions, and verifies them against given information.

Business Requirement 4:
As a banking customer, I want to sign my loan agreement digitally, so that I can complete my loan application process in a hassle-free manner.
Acceptance Criteria: The system presents the loan agreement to the customer and accepts their e-signature authenticated via OTP.
Roles: Banking Customer, IT Manager, Compliance Lead
Expected Behavior: The system generates the loan agreement based on approved details, presents it to the customer for review and accepts their e-signature after OTP-based verification.

Business Requirement 5:
As a banking customer, I want to track my loan application status online, so that I can be aware of the progress at all times.
Acceptance Criteria: The system shows the current status of the active loan application of the customer.
Roles: Banking Customer, Product Manager, IT Manager
Expected Behavior: The system updates the status of the loan application in real-time and allows the customer to check it anytime, anywhere.

Business Requirement 6:
As a bank executive, I want the system to significantly reduce manual data entry and turnaround time, so I can provide faster, more efficient service.
Acceptance Criteria: The system auto-fills data where possible and processes applications quickly, reducing manual data entry and overall TAT.
Roles: Bank Executive, Business Head-Retail Lending, IT Manager
Expected Behavior: The system utilizes Aadhaar/PAN-based pre-fill, real-time verification, and other features to expedite processes and minimize manual tasks.

Blockers will be addressed by a contingency plan that includes alternate data access methods, user comfort strategies for digital adoption, and adaptive compliance strategies to handle RBI guidelines updates.

### Contents

## 1. Background
The current loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. The management wants to digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans.

## 2. As-is Process
The as-is process steps are documented below (as-is process diagram):
<<Image>>

## 3. Business Requirements
### 3.1 Functional Requirements
- Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based pre-fill.
- Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score.
- AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module.
- Real-time KYC document verification (OCR + face match).
- Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication.
- Integration with core banking for disbursement.

### 3.2 System Orchestration Requirements
- File Storage: To be defined
- Output File Library: To be defined

### 3.3 UI/UX Requirements
- Login Screen: Users are expected to log in using Single Sign-On (SSO) when accessing. This login mechanism enhances security and streamlines the authentication process.
- User Role-Based Access:
  - Manager Role: Managers should be granted access to cases, empowering them to utilize both the upload and download functionalities of the automation. This role ensures that managerial users have the necessary permissions for case-related activities.
  - Admin Role: Admin access, reserved for select team members, provides comprehensive access to the entire application. This privileged role is designated for individuals who require full control and oversight of the application's functionalities.

### 3.4 Non-Functional Requirements
- Audit Trail: A comprehensive audit trail will be maintained to track user activities within the application. This includes capturing user-specific information such as usernames, date and time stamps, and the type of activities performed.
- Monitoring and Reporting: The system will collect log data to monitor the number of active users and track individual usernames. Additionally, performance metrics of the application will be recorded.
- Security: User authentication will be implemented using secure protocols. This security measure ensures that only authenticated users with proper credentials can access the system, enhancing overall system security.
- Reliability: The system is committed to maintaining a minimum uptime, excluding scheduled maintenance.

## 4. To Be Process
Anticipated Procedural Steps for MVP-1:
- The Team initializes the application login procedure upon receipt of emails.
- Subsequently, the team systematically transfers files, utilizing them as inputs for the designated tool.

## 5. Assumptions
- Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number
- System must support English and Hindi
- Loan disbursement only through verified bank accounts

## 6. Inclusions and Exclusions
Inclusions of the project are as follows:
- Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based pre-fill.
- Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score.
- AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module.
- Real-time KYC document verification (OCR + face match).
- Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication.
- Integration with core banking for disbursement.

Exclusions for the project are as follows:
- Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules.
- Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions.

## 7. Data Sources
### 7.1 Input Data Sources
To be defined

### 7.2 Output Data Sources
To be defined

## 8. Glossary of Data
To be defined

## Compliance Rules

| Rule ID | Description | Category | Severity | Applicable Standards |
|---------|-------------|----------|----------|-----------------------|
| R1      | The system must ensure the secure storage and transmission of Aadhaar and PAN data during pre-fill of the online loan application form. | Data | High | GDPR, ISO 27001 |
| R2      | The system must securely integrate with CIBIL to fetch credit scores without exposing sensitive customer data. | Data | High | GDPR, ISO 27001 |
| R3      | The AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module must not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, or other protected characteristics. | Legal | High | Equal Credit Opportunity Act (ECOA), Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) |
| R4      | The system must ensure secure and accurate real-time KYC document verification. | Data | High | GDPR, ISO 27001 |
| R5      | The system must securely implement OTP-based authentication for loan sanction and e-agreement signing. | Security | High | ISO 27001 |
| R6      | The system must securely integrate with core banking for disbursement. | Data | High | GDPR, ISO 27001 |
| R7      | The system must implement secure Single Sign-On (SSO) for user login. | Security | High | ISO 27001 |
| R8      | User roles (Manager and Admin) must be properly defined and enforced to prevent unauthorized access. | Security | High | ISO 27001 |
| R9      | The system must maintain a comprehensive audit trail of user activities. | Operational | High | ISO 27001 |
| R10     | The system must collect log data for monitoring and reporting purposes. | Operational | Medium | ISO 27001 |
| R11     | The system must ensure a minimum uptime, excluding scheduled maintenance. | Operational | Medium | ISO 27001 |
| R12     | The system must support both English and Hindi languages. | Legal | Medium | Language Equality and Acquisition for Deaf Kids (LEAD-K) |
| R13     | Loan disbursement must only be through verified bank accounts. | Legal | High | Anti-Money Laundering (AML) regulations |
| R14     | The system must exclude home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. | Operational | Low | N/A |
| R15     | The system must exclude agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. | Operational | Low | N/A |
